job_title: Customer Experience in Leeds, England
pros: Good pay, great people and opportunity to progress
cons: Busy phone lines at times

job_title: Information Technology
pros: Great work life balance Leeds 'office' is the best workplace i've ever experienced Most people are wonderful to work with Ambitious strategy Interesting and challenging work
cons: Leadership in IT could be better - lack of empathy & engagement and a blame culture makes for dysfunctional working relationships. Knee jerk decision making can be unsettling Too many senior managers are seen to be leaving which makes for an unstable work environment

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Leeds, England
pros: Pay good, if you like working from home, great people
cons: Too focused on achieving targets rather than supporting tenants!! Not very flexible when ask to attend an appointment . Don’t listen to staff and work in an old fashioned command and control environment. Change was dropped on frontline, poor communication.

job_title: Asbestos and Legionella Manager in Leeds, England
pros: Some great people to work with and very flexible in their work approach
cons: No progression or effort to retain good, hardworking staff and poor leadership support

review_title: Challenging but the team are very supportive
job_title: Customer Service Advisor in Leeds, England
pros: Colleagues/managers are really amazing and helpful The office is a really nice, modern, eco-friendly workspace Get given a phone and laptop and lots of office equipment for home working They give you ample break/lunch time
cons: Tenants can sometimes be hard to work with and aggressive Expected to take lots of calls a day Hard to socialise much in office due to nature of job being on calls all day

review_title: Great culture, great people who care about the YH customer experience.
job_title: senior business change manager in Leeds, England
pros: Yorkshire Housing is a not-for-profit organisation providing affordable housing for their customers across Yorkshire. They seem to get the balance right between putting the customer first, whilst being commercially driven. The work philosophy is to recruit the right thinking people, treat them as adults and trust them to contribute value into the organisation. It's a relatively new leadership team and the organisation is looking to establish a clear vision and invest appropriately to enable its delivery. Really exciting times!
cons:
The organisation adopts a "Home, Roam & Hub" Philosophy to working i.e. default is you work from home, but have the opportunity to meet colleagues face-to-face, and are currently standing-up a hub in Leeds City Centre.

Building trusted relationships whilst working from home is challenging. Not impossible, but challenging.

review_title: Great employer and truly agile approach to where, when and how you work
job_title: Chief Executive Officer in Leeds, England
pros: Great culture and fantastic people
cons: There aren't any - great place to work and highly recommend.

job_title: Defects Administrator in Leeds, England
pros: Flexible home working contracts for all employees, good pension scheme and transparent management
cons: Large workload in some areas, sometimes inefficient ways of working

review_title: Dynamic and future-focused organisation, committed to the development of young talent.
job_title: People and Culture Graduate in Leeds, England
pros:
Ambitious strategy
Honest and approachable leadership team
Clear commitment to building an inclusive workplace
cons: Missing the social side of working face to face

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Leeds, England
pros:
Lots of investment in innovation led by CEO
Flex hrs
Agile working
Hub, Home, Roam working practice
Very experienced colleagues 
Friendly staff
Change of mind set and culture towards more staff friendly 
Social purpose therefore sense of achievement
cons:
Very old processes that need updating 
Lots of gaps in processes
Lots of money spent on contractors when internal talent could be utilised better
Salary static
No bonus scheme

remote

job_title: Asbestos Manager in Leeds, England
pros: Very flexible working, good location
cons: Awful culture,self importance and preservation

job_title: Customer Service Advisor in Leeds, England
pros: friendly management. take individual needs into account
cons: difficult, soul destroying, requires thick skin

job_title: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) in Leeds, England
pros: fantastic culture and a grown up and pragmatic approach
cons: None I can think of

job_title: Accountant in Leeds, England
pros: Friendly colleagues and flexible working
cons: None that I can think of

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Leeds, England
pros:
35 hour working week.
Real emphasis on staff well being.
Emphasis on staff development.
Interesting work and a push on innovation and leading within the sector.
Embracing home working and flexible working - but also conscious of those that would benefit being in the office.
Haven't met a miserable or unhelpful person yet. 
Can't believe that I'm saying this - but a management team that actually listens and acts on feedback and really do try their best to support staff. The CEO is head and shoulders above any other CEO that I've had - approachable, practical, accessible and sensible.
cons: Would like to see slightly more open communication within the middle management layers, but even saying this it's really not that big an issue (and probably me being fussy, or just a reflection of me being with the company only a short time).

job_title: Lettings Administrator in Leeds, England
pros:
I worked here for over a year and half and picked up a lot of housing related experience and knowledge

There’s lots of opportunities to develop and there are lots of good people. I’ve made lots of great work friends 

The result of working here has meant that I have been able to get an even better job
cons: They are currently going through a restructuring/ consultation and as a result good staff are leaving and people are naturally worried.

review_title: Cannot Fault the Company or the Managers
job_title: Facilities Assistant in Leeds, England
pros: Everyone in the Leeds office was friendly and helpful. As a facilities assistant you get to know everyone in the office as you might get called to restock the printers or the kitchen tea supply. The managers were great and really wanted to help me progress in my career path.
cons: I couldn't find any cons

review_title: Good place to work but temporary contracts
job_title: Senior Administrator in Northallerton, England
pros: Friendly colleagues, good work ethic and helpful. Flexible working but only in some roles.
cons: Uncertain renewals of temporary contracts make it hard to plan ahead. The company is currently restructuring

job_title: West Yorkshire in Bradford, Yorkshire and the Humber, England
pros:
Great training and personal development support
Opportunities 
Really great values 
Really listen and make changes suggested by employees
Good support of employee wellbeing
cons: Lots of change currently so job uncertainty

job_title: Facilities Maintenance Technician in Leeds, England
pros: Great company to work for, friendly management, flexible hours, overtime available, high team ethic
cons: There aren’t any at the moment.

job_title: Manager in Leeds, England
pros: Great company with a social purpose and opportunities to progress
